greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let c be the n-th composite number. Then a(n) is the smallest base b > 1 such that b^(c-1) == 1 (mod c^2), i.e., such that c is a 'Wieferich pseudoprime'.
link: Felix Fröhlich, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3000
mathematica: c = Select[Range@ 69, CompositeQ]; f[c_] := Block[{b = 2}, While[Mod[b^(c - 1), c^2] != 1, b++]; b]; f /@ c (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 03 2015 *)
program: (PARI) forcomposite(c=1, 1e3, b=2; while(Mod(b, c^2)^(c-1)!=1, b++); print1(b, ", "))
results.author: _Felix Fröhlich_, Apr 01 2015
